Articles.Content:
32-bit Windows XP

KSP Version 0.90.0 Beta

No mods or add-ons

I had a crash while I was landing on Eve - the textures started failing to load as I descended, then it crashed. I expect I was running low on memory; it's an older computer.

Now when I try to start the program it crashes immediately (no load screen or anything).

The crash folders and dxdiag output are available here: https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B-JY_nE4xvAfeWRRUlVKQlZZVHc&usp=sharing

Thanks in advance for any help you can provide! I miss my favorite game.

Picasso

Not sure why, but your video card isn't initialising properly. I'd recommend reinstalling and/or updating your video card's drivers. The DxDiag is also listing your card as having no VRAM and no Direct3D support, which should be effectively impossible.

If updating or reinstalling the drivers doesn't fix anything, you should probably have the video card double checked in a repair shop or something (or test it in another machine if you have a spare one lying around), in case it overheated and got damaged somehow.
